summary: An ordinance appropriating the sum of $0.50 out of the general fund of the City of Seattle, which sum represents the amount of the advertising cost in favor of Helen Caughlin, who purchased lots 17, 18, 19, and 20, block 3, Terrace Hill Addition (an unrecorded plat) which were sold in error by the Treasurer on May 22, 1911, and directing the Treasurer to reinstate the original assessment; for the reason that an appeal in now pending in the Supreme Court by Alfred Carlson, the owner thereof.
